document.title: What Happens When We Read: Picturing a Readerâ€™s Responsibilities
document.abstract: A graphic representation of reading as a process enables students to respond more fully and responsibly to literature by attending to what they contribute to the act of reading, what the world to the text can offer, what kinds of responses are available to them, and what they can do to make sure they have responded as thoughtfully as possible.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Laurence Musgrove is Associate Professor of English at Saint Xavier University where he teaches courses in writing and contemporary American poetry. His research interests include the oral histories of Middle Eastern Americans and the ways in which students visualize what happens when they read. He also coordinates the Middle Eastern Studies program and chairs a taskforce on revising the general education program at SXU.
